thread.title: The Boston Yeti is back and was on the loose in a local doughnut shop
thread.title_full: The Boston Yeti is back and was on the loose in a local doughnut shop

title: The Boston Yeti is back and was on the loose in a local doughnut shop
text:
The snow is falling in Boston, which means the Boston Yeti is at it again.
I've made the call! Tomorrow is a #snowday ! Right, @marty_walsh ? @steveannear @MarcNBCBoston #BOSnow #blizzard #bostonWeather #bostonyeti pic.twitter.com/4TBdzTcPyD
— Boston Yeti 2015 (@BostonYeti2015) February 9, 2017
The famous furry creature who’s become synonymous with Boston snowstorms spent Thursday morning’s nor’easter amidst both snowflakes and doughnuts. The Yeti stopped into Somerville’s Union Square Donuts , where he spent time with customers and took a trip to the kitchen.
Swing by the somerville shop for some pre-blizzard donuts with @BostonYeti2015 pic.twitter.com/CqOPoxTnvJ
— Union Square Donuts (@UnionSqDonuts) February 9, 2017
Donuts and snowstorms go so well together! @UnionSqDonuts @BostInno @BostonTweet #bosnow #snowday #snowstorm2017 #bostonyeti pic.twitter.com/ZRsBHfeOWA
— Boston Yeti 2015 (@BostonYeti2015) February 9, 2017
My first yeti selfie!! @BostonYeti2015 @UnionSqDonuts pic.twitter.com/TEmc520Xdn
— Gary Vogel (@GVogel18) February 9, 2017
In December 2015, the Boston Yeti revealed himself to be Somerville resident John Campopiano in an interview with The Improper Bostonian . Bostonians seem really happy he’s back for another winter:
Ye #bringit #bostonyeti https://t.co/DnjOlQtH0P
— kara wilmarth (@karaw15) February 9, 2017
Ladies and gentlemen, after a 1 year weather hiatus @BostonYeti2015 is back!!! pic.twitter.com/Q2H53wz0J6
— Katie Matt (@katematt) February 9, 2017
Union Square Donuts closed at noon Thursday due to the weather.
We are closing at 12noon today at all of our locations due to the snow. Be safe out there!
— Union Square Donuts (@UnionSqDonuts) February 9, 2017
However, it seems the Boston Yeti is still out there in the snow.
